headline: Why analysts think Trump’s 10% credit card fee cap is a low-probability risk
summary: Investing.com -- President Trump’s proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10% has drawn attention, but analysts say the risk of meaningful disruption to financial stocks is low.

raw.headline: Why analysts think Trump’s 10% credit card fee cap is a low-probability risk
raw.summary: Investing.com -- President Trump’s proposal to cap credit card interest rates at 10% has drawn attention, but analysts say the risk of meaningful disruption to financial stocks is low.

headline: FIS Launches Industry-First Offering Enabling Banks to Lead and Scale in Agentic Commerce
summary: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., January 12, 2026--FIS® (NYSE: FIS), a global leader in financial technology, today announced the launch of its first offering to enable agentic commerce on the heels of announcing the close of the acquisition of its FIS Total Issuing™ Solutions portfolio. FIS’ new agentic commerce offering is the first to enable banks to safely and securely conduct commerce with AI agents and card networks.

raw.headline: FIS Launches Industry-First Offering Enabling Banks to Lead and Scale in Agentic Commerce

FIS’ new agentic commerce offering is the first to enable banks to safely and securely conduct commerce with AI agents and card networks.

headline: GTCR Completes Sale of Worldpay to Global Payments
summary: GTCR, a leading private equity firm, announced today that it has closed the previously announced sale of Worldpay (the "Company"), a global leader in merchant acquiring and payments processing, to Global Payments (NYSE: GPN) as part of a transformative three-way transaction. The sale of Worldpay represents one of the largest strategic sales in the history of the private equity industry.

raw.headline: GTCR Completes Sale of Worldpay to Global Payments
raw.summary: GTCR, a leading private equity firm, announced today that it has closed the previously announced sale of Worldpay (the "Company"), a global leader in merchant acquiring and payments processing, to Global Payments (NYSE: GPN) as part of a transformative three-way transaction. The sale of Worldpay represents one of the largest strategic sales in the history of the private equity industry.

headline: FIS Completes Strategic Acquisition of Global Payments’ Issuer Solutions Business and Sale of Worldpay Stake
summary: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., January 12, 2026--FIS® (NYSE: FIS), a global leader in financial technology, today announced the completion of its acquisition of Global Payments' Issuer Solutions business, formerly known as TSYS, for an enterprise value of $13.5 billion, or a net purchase price of $12 billion including $1.5 billion of net present value of tax assets. Offerings from this asset, the world’s largest issuing business, will now go to market under the FIS® Total Issuing™ Solutions portfolio brand
